TopicTitle: What did you do in KSP1 today?

Articles.Content:
I didn't play the game at all, but I did make a texture map of what Kerbin might look like at night, for a very promising mod.

Here's an example image from before I completed it:

I got a 7 ships caravan towards Minmus for building a kethane base and an orbital refueling station. Each ships payload is about 75tone . So its quiet the caravan. Of and i forgot the 2 ships following with 1 heavy duty rovers each for orbital-land base randevouze.

Today, I opened up 0.20 to finish of my probic Jool Moons Tour.

After scanning Bop, Jooluis Xena dispatched its second last rover.

Aiming with mapsat, I guided it down to one particular anomaly...

As I drove closer, I switched to the rovers on board camera. It only has one, fixed and looking forward, as these rovers had to be light and simple. I was very cautious when approaching, and circling the beast, especially when it was out of view. But, when I got round the front, I was reassured the creature was definitely dead.

Then I went and visited my other rovers on the inner moons of Jool. When I get round to landing on Pol, I'll've finally touched every body in the solar system.

I was checking out the Open-Source Aesthetics Tips thread the other night and got it in my head to build a Soyuz-style craft. I used KW, AIES, Procedural Fairings, and my own hand-rolled stock-replacement engines to make this happen. It's a bit stubby for a Soyuz but a Hitchhiker on top of the reentry pod really didn't look right.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

I contemplated suicide and didn't play KSP

still contemplated.

I contemplated suicide and didn't play KSP

still contemplated.

Please, call a Hotline immediately!

Suicide isn't a solution! I don't know you or the trouble you are in, but there is ALWAYS a better way to handle it.

I've got a special (KSP)challenge for you: PM me every day now and tell me whatever you want. I'll try to help you, even when my english is very bad...

Today a flew a Soviet-style MÃƒÂ¼n Mission (instead of an Apollo-style mission). Link below.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/52286

I got a ship into orbit around Kerbin, the plan is to go to the Mun with it but I need to change the orbital axis first to match the Mun's before I do a burn to go there, only started playing KSP yesterday! Got a satellite into orbit last night!
Destroy and deorbit things that use a mod I need to uninstall. All to keep memory usage low, stop crashes and keep my savegame.
Got my Rover into orbit and prepared for my burn to Minmus. Jeb will have his new Ion-powered toy soon!

Delivered a rover to my Munar research outpost near an arch. It took a little tumble down a hill, but luckily landed right-side up with nothing broken. The skycrane even made it into a 9x80k orbit for later recovery.

Delivered a rover to my Munar research outpost near an arch. It took a little tumble down a hill, but luckily landed right-side up with nothing broken. The skycrane even made it into a 9x80k orbit for later recovery.

Why would you recover a skycrane?
Landed a Extraplanetary Launchpads's launchpad on the Mun and is currently scanning for ore and kethane.
i didn't do this in KSP,but i thought it was cool.My Picture of the moon!:

Launched a HUGE solar-electric spacecraft to orbit. It's waiting for the next launch window to open to anywhere. I'm hoping to make a "grand tour" with it, and I have high hopes, especially since I have 24,000+ m/s dV aboard. I'll have to post pics of it. It's so big, even Jeb's afraid to come within 2 km of it!

Nothing particularly crazy, I launched a network of 12 tiny communications satellites around Kerbin, another 3 around both Minmus and the Mun. My new save has yet to progress past the Kerbin system, so no interplanetary travel yet.

Apologies if you can't make much out, but this is the most painful (successful) landing I've ever done. I had so little light I couldn't even check my own shadow (yes, I was stupid and forgot a lamp), it was basically instruments only. The angle was so unstable that the mere act of loading the scene was enough to make the lander slowly tip over and break. After a few tries I moved it to a slightly better place 4km up the crater field.

The result (after an accelerated rest until midday) - well met, komrades! The big tanker-rover will be abandoned on the surface since it was...pretty useless, actually. Subassembly will make these things much handier in the future. This is the first time I got crews of separate missions to meet up with each other on the surface of any body except Kerbin. Bill took these guys home.

I invented something called "kinetic reloading"

Throw the missile at the other ship, and use its RCS to catch the missile. not too easy.
I landed on Minmus for the first time in ages.

I invented something called "kinetic reloading"

Throw the missile at the other ship, and use its RCS to catch the missile. not too easy.

Try throwing 70 tons and docking without RCS.

Try throwing 70 tons and docking without RCS.

wow! Impressive.

The biggest thing's ive put together was a 60 ton fuel module on a 150 ton Station with really flimsy Sr. docking ports. Took about an hour, but i did it. and i got the solar panels to line up.

I built a SSTO Spaceplane out of (mainly) B9 Aerospace parts. It has a SCIENCE!Ã¢â€žÂ¢ bay (instruments, batteries, xenon tank, RCS tanks), a payload bay and enough fuel to get to orbit with some leeway. Pictured above is the Mun/Minmus lander that was docked in the payload bay moving to a parking position while an (off-screen) refuelling rig is readied to dock and refill the tanks.

In the middle of a 2 hour, 30 minute ion engine "burn" that will sling me around the sun and meet up with Eve in about a month. Mechjeb is an absolute must for that kind of work...

EDIT: Burn completed without issue. Craft has entered a 35 day cruise down inside the orbit of Moho, then back up to Eve. I have two options at that point: a two hour flyby window (SoI shift to SoI shift), or enter into orbit.

Decisions, decisions.

Edited October 12, 2013 by MaverickSawyer
Today i discovered how to use rcs thrusters to dock my craft together...it makes docking almost too easy!

First manned mission to Duna with an actual return to Kerbin. 2 Kerbals, Bob and Bill.

Few months ago I made a total KSP spree, landing Kerbals on every body except Tylo, without return. Now I use a rational approach. Everything has been visited my probes (except Tylo), and only MÃƒÂ¼n, Minmus and Duna had Kerbals jumping around.
